content: the scarf you like for reference i made a slightly wide mini scarf that does not need to be wrapped around twice and this meant that for my yarn and hook size i increased +2 extra row until i reached 11 stitches 11 loops on my hook 4 middle section you ll continue making tks row forward & return pass until you are happy with the length of your middle section it should at least reach a length that allows you to comfortably wrap it around your neck disre- garding the increase section + a few cm to fold it for reference my middle section measured 53 cm if you prefer a longer scarf double the length to allow you to wrap it twice once you reach the desired lenght stop the return pass if you have 3 loops remaining 5 decrease section once you are happy with the length of your middle section you are ready to startdecreasingagain ifyoudothiscorrectly thetipsofyourscarfwillnarrow on the same edge 3 1 having left the last three loops from your final return pass of the middle section on your hook you will take off all three instead of the standard two loops at once to make your first decrease 2 you will continue with the forward pass of tks in the stitches and should endupwithanumberofstitchesequaltoyourmiddlesectionminus1 in mycase 10stitches pleasecheckthatyouinsertyourhookinthecorrect vertical bars i e skipping the first which looks a bit bigger because you have decreased in the previous row otherwise you risk increasing the number of stitches inadvertedly 3 continue with the return pass and make one tks row forward & return pass 4 make another tks row but stop once your return pass leaves 3 loops on your hook take off all three at once to make another decrease 5 continue with steps 2 to 4 until you are left with two loops on your hook make two more tks row with these two loops 6 end off the decrease section by slip stitching within the vertical bars like you would with a tks stitch do not fasten_off as you ll add edging in the last step 6 edge & finish off you ll now finish off by adding an edge and weaving in loose ends for this grab your regular crochet hook i used size 6 scissors and needle therearemanywaysyoucanfinishofftheedgeofyourminiscarf includ- ing single crochets and picot stitch i used a standard slip_stitch mainly because i like emphasizing the knit look of the scarf and i did not have a lot of yarn left forslipstitch slipstitchacrossthewholeedgeofyourminiscarf making sure that you do not tighten your stitches too much that would result in your scarf curling 4 onceyouhavereturnedtoyourfirstslipstitch slipstitchtogether fasten off and cut yarn and weave in your ends i hope you enjoy wearing your mini scarf feel free to tag me on instagram @aclairecrochet to
